greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table read by rows, T(0,0) = 1 and for n>0, 0<=k<=2^(n-1) T(n,k) = gcd(k,2^(n-1)).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..13 of triangle, flattened
formula: For n > 0: Let S be the n-th row, S' = replace the initial term by its double, then row (n+1) = concatenation of S' and the reverse of S' without the initial term. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 26 2013
program: f (x:xs) = ys ++ tail (reverse ys) where ys = (2 * x) : xs
xref: Cf. A094373 (row lengths), A045623 (row sums), A011782 (edges and central terms).
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Nov 12 2011
